content: chart by drawing sloping lines from the sides starting with mc at the end join the braid seamlessly as shown in towards the tip start the tip decreases the linked video tutorial the braid is 2-color but all sts on needles are in mc decrease round work twice k1 ssk work the appropriate center sts of the chart to 3 sts before the marker k2tog k1 sm use start working the chart place a marker at the indicated spot either color for the decreases and the side stitches separating the hand and the palm/thumb sections make sure you use the chart of the chosen size and appropriate hand left or right repeat the decrease round until 14/16/16/16/16 sts remain break the cc yarn work a decrease round with mc only and graft work the chart to row 21/23/26/28/33 the row is worked slightly the remaining sts differently in left and right hand left hand work the row to the first move the thumb sts onto a spare cable or scrap yarn cast on e g long tail co or two-sided charted new sts work the remaining 2 sts before the marker slip marker work the rest of the round right hand work the row to the thumb sts 2 sts after the marker move the thumb sts onto a spare cable or scrap yarn cast on charted new sts work the rest of the round ©aino vikman 2024 this pattern is a free ravelry download intended for individual use it may not be reproduced or sold version 1 8 2024 page | 5 slippery road ahead mittens 3 thumb 4 finishing move the stitches on hold to working needle s weave in yarn ends give the mittens a gentle bath shape and let pick up and work the charted 2/3/3/4/4 sts from the cast-on edge dry additionally to avoid possible holes you can pick up and knit an extra stitch on both ends of the cast-on edge and decrease them if the mittens are worn when driving a car on slippery roads add a away on the next round few drops of anti-slip glue to the ribbing area of the thumb and the work the first row of the thumb and join to knit the thumb in a round corresponding area in the palm to get a better grip on the steering work the thumb chart until the thumb is long enough the decreases wheel 😊 do not add length break the cc yarn mark the last full row in the chart if the chart ends before reaching the required length return to the first thumb row and continue from there knit a round repeat k2tog for two rounds break the yarn pull the yarn through the last stitches and
